data.name: Stream To Image Step By Step
data.description:
Stream To Image Step By Step

We imagine by absurdity that civilization has lost all its technology. The project's chief engineer to create a new image format asks you to implement his algorithm. He gives you the specifications:

Namespace:

```StreamToImageStepByStep ```

Class Name:

```Decode```

Class Property:

``` // map of char tolleracne: 0%-20% 20%-40% 40%-60% 60%-80% 80%-100% static char[] Map = new char[] { ' ' , '░' , '▒' , '▓' , '█' }; string ImageString // contains the image made of character map int[][] imageCahrMap // contains a pattern for ImageString int[][][] imagePixelMap // contains RBG pixel byte[] Stream // stream input ```

Class Method:

``` public Decoder(String StreamStringInput) // ClassBuilder !!do not touch :) public byte[] GenerateStreamFromString(String StreamStringInput) //this method must convert incoming stream from string to byte array public int[][][] DecodeStreamForRBGPixel(byte[] Stream) //this method must convert stramin in RGB pixels iamge public int[][] GenerateCharMap(int[][][] PixelMap) //this method must convert image in CharMap public string DecodeCharMap(int[][] CharMap) //this method must convert CharMap in sting ```

instructions to build the image:

In de calss builder we have in input a strung ```StreamStringInput```, this string contains a bit of stream ```00001111 00101001 01011110 01011100 00111111 01100000 01001000 01010011 ...``` you have to build all the methods that lead to the realization of the image in ```GenerateStreamFromString``` you have to turn the string into an actual stream of bytes ```byte[] { 15, 41, 94, 92, 63, 96, 72, 83,...};``` then the data is formatted in the following way ``` stream[0] contain a heigth of image, stream[1] contain a whith of image stream[2-4] contains a RBG of 1° pixel; stream[5-7] contains a RBG of 2° pixel; ... stream[n-(n+2)] cntains a RGB of ((n-2)/3)° pixel; ``` with the ```DecodeStreamForRBGPixel``` method you have to transform the stream into a 3-dimensional array where the first and the height, the second the width and the third from the size of 3 with the RGB of the pixel ``` int[heigth][whith][3] ``` I our case ``` int[][][]{ new int[][] {new int[] {94,92,63},...}, ... }; ``` with ```GenerateCharMap``` the image must be transformed into a pattern that maps the image, where the pizels range from 0 to 4, respectively representing the percentage 0 = from 0% to 20%, 1 = from 20% to 40% ... average of the colors in RGB for example the medium 70, 255, 80 = 153 then the percentile is ```153: 255 = X: 100``` so it is 52% so 3 I our case ``` int[][]{ new int[] {1,...}, }; ``` lastly we make a conversion to an actually visible image the ```DecodeCharMap``` method transforms the pattern into an image must each line is separated by \ n and each value is converted by following this rule: ``` 0=' ' 1='░' 2='▒' 3='▓' 4='█' ``` I our case ``` ░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░█████████░░░░░░░░░░ ░░███████░░░░░░░░░░███▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒███░░░░░░░░ ░░█▒▒▒▒▒▒█░░░░░░░███▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒███░░░░░ ░░░█▒▒▒▒▒▒█░░░░██▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒██░░░ ░░░░█▒▒▒▒▒█░░░██▒▒▒▒▒██▒▒▒▒▒▒██▒▒▒▒▒███░░ ░░░░░█▒▒▒█░░░█▒▒▒▒▒▒████▒▒▒▒████▒▒▒▒▒▒██░ ░░░█████████████▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒██░ ░░░█▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒█▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒█▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒██░ ░██▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒█▒▒▒██▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒██▒▒▒▒██░ ██▒▒▒███████████▒▒▒▒▒██▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒██▒▒▒▒▒██░ █▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒█▒▒▒▒▒▒████████▒▒▒▒▒▒▒██░ ██▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒█▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒██░░ ░█▒▒▒███████████▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒██░░░░ ░██▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒████▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒▒█░░░░░░ ░░████████████░░░█████████████████░░░░░░░ ```

Now, good luck, and FUN
